channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12467] Master joins cluster but never completes initialization
item.description:
While diagnosing a rare failure in IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify, I discovered this scenario. Master was restarted by CM. Upon rejoining the cluster it successfully assumes responsibility as active master, but apparently the finishInitialization method never completes. The last log line from that thread is

2014-11-10 17:01:29,940 INFO  [master:ip-172-31-9-135:60000] master.HMaster: hbase:meta with replicaId 0 assigned=0, rit=false, location=ip-172-31-9-136.ec2.internal,60020,1415638551951

I see region states populated from existing znodes. AM inventoried the online regions, acknowledged that this was master failover. There it sits, responding to RPC's with PleaseHoldException: Master is initializing.

For the sake of resiliency, we should detect this scenario and at least release control as active master.
item.summary: Master joins cluster but never completes initialization

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here's a fix to at least detect this kind of thing with the option to let the operator follow the Erlang approach.

Tried raising SIGKILL before exiting but I guess it does not invoke the vm-level handler, at least on a Mac.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unhandled signal: SIGQUIT

	at sun.misc.Signal.raise(Signal.java:196)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster$InitializationMonitor.run(HMaster.java:194)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

Ok. I wonder why we hung? Maybe do a thread dump before you system.exit? See Threads#threadDumpingIsAlive down in its guts. +1
Thanks Stack, that's exactly what I was looking for.
